com.basho.riak.client.operations

Class CounterObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.basho.riak.client.operations.CounterObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RiakOperation<Long>

    public class CounterObject
extends Object
implements RiakOperation<Long>
    A new feature in Riak 1.4 is counters. These are implemented via convergent data types.

    A counter is uniquely identified by its name (key) in a bucket. The first time you increment a counter, it is created. A counter can be decremented by incrementing it by a negative value; 

     // Create and increment a counter by 1
 CounterObject c = bucket.counter("myCounter");
 Long l = c.increment(1L).returnValue(true).execute();
 
 // fetch an existing counter value
 l = bucket.counter("myCounter").execute();
    Author:
    Brian Roach
    See Also:
    A Comprehensive study of Convergent and Commutative Replicated Data Types

      • execute

        public Long execute()
             throws RiakException
        Execute this counter operation
        Specified by:
        execute in interface RiakOperation<Long>
        Returns:
        The value of the counter or null if the counter does not exist or an increment is performed has not specified to return the new value via returnValue(boolean)
        Throws:
        RiakException
